results.title: Rohani steps out
results.brief_description: A shy young Malay housewife, Rohani, is persuaded by the village headman’s wife to join her local Women’s Institute. There she finds companionship in learning new crafts and skills among women of different races and creeds. Later Rohani is able to help other housewives, by teaching them the skills she has acquired, and by persuading them to join the Women’s Institue.

results.title: Rogerstone
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films and Northern Aluminium Company
results.brief_description: A survey of the continuous aluminium strip rolling mill at Rogerstone, where modern machinery, mechanical handling and efficient factory layout enable single ingots of aluminium to be rolled in continuous lengths of as much as 3,500 feet. The opening of this mill in 1950 increased Britain’s aluminium sheet rolling capacity by one-third.

results.title: Roger Kemp
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Painters, the sculptors: archival art series”.
Roger Kemp is one of Australia’s most important artists of the 20th Century. In this documentary Kemp seeks to describe his personal and intense creative vision. Not unlike a scientist in approach, Kemp is systematic, thorough and precise in his exploration in what he calls ‘the mathematics of aesthetic’. He describes how his exploration is closely linked to music and the discovery of an abstract symbol. He goes on to describe his views on spirituality in art and how this always sits behind the motivation of creativity. In terms of music Kemp describes emotion and abstraction in painting as performing the function as an octave does in music.

results.title: Rodin's inferno = L'enfer de Rodin (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Art film on the works of the great French sculptor Rodin. The film, which has no commentary, attempts to illustrate the meeting of two dreams, that of Dante and that of Rodin. Two titles are used, one at the opening of the film, “Life … that miracle (Rodin)” and another before the Descent into Hell “Abandon hope all ye who enter here … (Dante)”. Using lighting effects and camera movement, the film brings to life the world of Rodin’s statues, working from the two principal sources of the sculptor’s inspiration, Love and Pain. His works are grouped according to the following themes:-The Creation of Man and Woman; Love and the Human Passion; Old Age; Poverty and Decay; the Descent into Hell, and the Vision of Hell

results.title: Rodeo Red and the runaway
results.creator_credit: Doro Bachrach, Bert Salzman and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
A young adolescent girl unable to cope with the relationship between her father and her new stepmother, runs away from home and is taken in by a woman farmer living nearby. During this time she comes to terms with her mother’s death, her relationship with her stepmother and her own self-centred attitudes. Based on the book “Shelter from the wind” by Marion Dane Daver.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Doro Bachrach, Bert Salzman and Learning Corporation of America

results.title: Rocks that originate underground
results.creator_credit: Stanley Croner, Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Explains the formation of typical igneous and metamorphic rocks and the conditions under which they are formed according to indirect evidence. Also, the program investigates the requirements for the formation of intergrown crystalline mineral grains. Suitable for Upper Primary and Lower Secondary.
